basic.description:
A multi-day field trip that uses stratigraphic, sedimentological, paleontological, and structural data to interpret shall-and-deep-marine rock successions in paleoenvironmental and tectonic context. Enrollment is limited. Course runs during the week of Canadian Thanksgiving.
NOTE    The course runs during the week that includes Canadian Thanksgiving. Students are responsible for the cost of accommodation and transportation during the trip.  Please contact the Department for more information.
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Field Studies in Geology II

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prereqsuite    (A GPA of 2.9 in GEOL221; GEOL238; GEOL321 or permission of the Dept.
Corequisite    GEOL488.
Exclusion     No more than 1.5 units from GEOL401; GEOL402.
